metadata.title: CVE-2017-5071 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Insufficient validation of untrusted input in V8 in Google Chrome prior to59.0.3071.86 for Linux, Windows and Mac, and 59.0.3071.92 for Androidallowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory read via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5071` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.16.04.1289
chromium-browser-l10n - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.16.04.1289
chromium-chromedriver - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.16.04.1289
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.16.04.1289
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.16.04.1289
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.16.04.1289').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'Ubuntu touch end-of-life').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
